website_summaries.verdict: This simple design is effective and easy to use. It filters water well, but owners must keep an eye on the age of the filters.
pros: With proper care, the simple design will hold up quite well
cons: Hard to tell when filters need to be changed
Works very slowly and has a limited capacity of 10 cups

website_summaries.verdict: Stands out for being excellent quality and an ideal shape and size.
pros: Users give this pitcher top marks for its improvement over previous designs, with a flawless size and shape
It is reported as being well worth the cost
Also stands out for being lightweight and providing good filtering for great-tasting water
cons: Occasional issues with lids and leakage
Lacks the electronic filter change reminder of other newer models

customer_reviews.title: Not any safer than tap water; does taste better
customer_reviews.text: By water filter, Brita is actually selling you odor remover. Even then I don’t know if it’s placebo. What a sham. I’d suggest you to buy a water tester and test Brita’s water along with your tap water and bottled water. My results were: Tap: 265 ppm Brita: 261 ppm Ozarka (mineral spring water): 37 ppm La croix (for fun): 55 ppm Disclaimer: I am using their longlast filter and it’s less than a month old. I am purifying 80 oz a day. (It should be lasting 6 months at least).
customer_reviews.author: sa

customer_reviews.title: ** ITEM IS NOT ELIGABLE FOR RETURNS **
customer_reviews.text: ** EVEN THOUGH THIS IS A PRIME ITEM, IT IS NOT ELIGABLE FOR RETURNS ** filter reservoir and pitcher are stuck together and can not be pulled apart to be cleaned as with other britas. This item is very cheaply made. Also the instructions describe a filter indicator light which is not there. The stars on this item have to be fake. Do not buy! You'd be better off lighting your money on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy Brita Stands Behind their Products
customer_reviews.text: Within 6 month developed a structural crack and leaked all over my refrigerator and kitchen floor. From other reviews appears to be an inherent problem. Happily, when I contacted Brita they offered a free replacement even past the 90 day warranty. Hoping pitcher number 2 will hold up better.
customer_reviews.author: mscake

customer_reviews.title: Brittle, very brittle. Quality is lacking.
customer_reviews.text: Not a sturdy product. It fell on the floor and a piece cracked off of the edge. Later it cracked as I was still trying to use it and it fell again. My older ones are still in use. The plastic is thin, thin. I wish I had bought it in a store and could have evaluated it in person. I would not have bought it! I nested the pieces then could not get them apart with hot and cold water (you know the routine). WASTED MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Emma A. Fine

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using Brita Water Filter Pitchers for many years and they've all been great! The reason why I've purchased this unit was only to replace our old pitcher for a fresh look and larger capacity. The difference between drinking tap-water and filtered water is immediately noticeable, so based on years of experience, I can highly recommend THIS brand to everyone! :-)
customer_reviews.author: MR.G.Top Contributor: Ham Radio

customer_reviews.title: Lid leaks, not returnable, DOES come apart for cleaning
customer_reviews.text: Major issue: lid is not tight, and will leak all over the place if there is water in the reservoir. See pictures. Second major issue: not returnable. Otherwise, it's fine. It's a good large size, the filter itself seems to be working fine. I'm replacing a smaller pitcher, so I'm already a fan of Brita filtration and the improvement in taste. It does come apart for cleaning, though not easily. I pulled and rocked the white reservoir from the spout, and it will slowly come apart. I wish the seal was as tight on the lid. I'm not impressed with this pitcher, and I wish I had gotten another one.
customer_reviews.author: dmichn

customer_reviews.title: Annoying
customer_reviews.text: I like the larger size of this pitcher. It is heavy when full but is well balanced so it is not unwieldy. The annoying part is that when you get almost to the bottom and are pouring, the lid will fall off and the filter will pop out. Yes it is installed properly and pushed all the way in. I always check to make sure, but the same thing happens every time. I guess it's not a HUGE deal, but it is still annoying!
customer_reviews.author: M. Kizer

customer_reviews.title: Not all the water goes through the filter =(
customer_reviews.text: Different from the Brita Pitcher I bought last time and did not realize. When I put the filter in it seems like it is not only going through the filter but running on the sides of it as well, which means some of the water is not going through the filtration system. And yes, it is in correctly. The last one I had I did not have this issue, and also had a flip top to easily refill without taking the whole top off, and had an indicator for the filter change. Those things would be fine with me, my real issue is the water that leaks through the sides of the filter and not through it. =(
customer_reviews.author: kmarie83

customer_reviews.title: One design error fixed; another rages on
customer_reviews.text: Well, they finally fixed those misshapen lids and these now fit fine. Unfortunately, there's another design error. The white reservoir is supposed to come out for cleaning, but it doesn't. Their online FAQ says to grab it by the hole where the filter goes and twist. Yeah, grab a hole, lol. They conveniently don't show a video of someone grabbing the hole. Why not just make a button by the handle that you depress for quick release?
customer_reviews.author: hh

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Brita had 100% satisfaction guarantee policy. But amazon doesn't give. Please think before ordering
customer_reviews.author: Balu

customer_reviews.title: After some redneck engineering I made it better!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to save my body from death due to the crappy water coming out of the faucet. using it after a while made me realize why in the hell would you sell me a 14 gallon jug that only holds 16oz of water. So I tore apart the container and just use the filter. I know it was a redneck move but come on folks It work much better now and fit perfect on top of this "reusable" container! Now it takes less space!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce E. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get well out
customer_reviews.text: I've used a different Brita pitcher for years and the well removed easily for cleaning the pitcher (as well as cleaning the well). While this well probably does come out, I'm not about to spend minutes trying to carefully wiggle it out. I have arthritis in my hands. There is nothing to grip. One would have to put their fingers into the place the filter goes and wrap the fingers around the bottom rungs and pull. I have tried to return it and it is not a returnable item. (Which I can understand for health reasons - though I didn't use it.) I've written to Brita.
customer_reviews.author: KarenN

customer_reviews.title: Develops Algae
customer_reviews.text: This pitcher worked fine for a few months but then developed algae in between the clear plastic and the bottom of the white part. The white part does not come out, so water gets trapped there without flow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It reads 318 ppm( super high for FILTERD H2O)
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure this works. Total dissolved solids read 318 and that’s really high. When I bought a pur filter pitcher it read at O. Brita wont get back to me. If you buy this brita buy a water tester and see what it reads. I don’t think brita stands by their word.
customer_reviews.author: jenny

customer_reviews.title: Product did not work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item based on the number of good reviews as compared to bad reviews. Unfortunately, I am in the smaller percentage of bad reviews. This product is very cheap and flimsy. The lid on the top didn't fit in properly so the water trickled out every time we poured water and, the water had a strong taste to it which definitely indicates it wasn't filtered thoroughly. I wouldn't have written this review except that for some reason, this item wasn't able to be returned so no exchange for a working product or no refund. Buyer beware, you can not return this product if it doesn't work. ***Since writing this, I have received a full refund! Thank you Brita.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley A.

customer_reviews.title: They won’t take your return. Waste of money. Bitter water.
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I can promise you. This product is a waste of money. I purchased, did a blind taste test. 3/3 family members chose tap over this water. It is bitter after filtration and we have tried everything to solve the issue. Not to mention, after 10 years of owning beta fish, and learning the hard way, betas need filtered water. So I decided to change my fishes water with my brand new filtered water system... 2 hours later he had passed away. Thanks Brita. Also... they don’t accept returns!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Rae

customer_reviews.title: Feel sick 100% of the time.
customer_reviews.text: At first, nothing was wrong, it was normal water that my husband and I drank every day. This past month has been hell, I feel sick all the time now and his teeth have been in so much pain. I don't understand how a filter can do that when the brita bottles are 100% fine. I'm aggrivated that I spent money on two of these just to get sick off of them. Not worth it. Don't buy it unless you want to feel like hurling anytime you eat or drink.
customer_reviews.author: bachelorsdeath

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY OR DRINK WATER FROM THIS FILTER!!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it last week and after about 5 cycle of a full pitcher of water, The water turned blackish with black color debris coming out of “filtered” water. Water was cleaner from tab than out of the filter.
customer_reviews.author: No Juan The

customer_reviews.title: Clean tasting water, cut the TDS in half.
customer_reviews.text: I finally picked one up to curb my reliance on bottled water. I was a bit skeptical about how useful these pitcher filters were. But after using it and using a test kit to measure the TDS, I'm pretty confident in it's performance. Not sure why some people are commenting on the difficulty of removing the reservoir to clean. It's not impossible. I mean... when I received my unit, the actual filter was inside the pitcher. It required removing the reservoir to even access it. I'd purchase this again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Dan V.

customer_reviews.title: Update: I'm just a sleep deprived idiot lol
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to upgrade to this pitcher. We've had our old Brita pitcher for 9 years! This one is bigger and we could use that with a family of 6. I just received the pitcher a couple days ago, I thought all was good. Until I started realizing the lid keeps popping off everytime I use the pitcher! The lid doesn't seem to fit properly:( I may have to return. ****update, correction this pitcher is great! I'm just an idiot and had the lid on backwards lol can I blame quarantine and lack of sleep? Capacity is great, water tastes good . Thumbs up Brita!
customer_reviews.author: S. Houser

customer_reviews.title: 3 months in and already cracked
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for 3 months and it cracked near the handle! Our previous brita filter lasted more then 18 months before we decided to buy a new one. With the new style lid, we thought it would be a nice upgrade But it's already cracked! We leave it on the kitchen counter, refill it in the sink right next to it so it doesn't hit anything and it's never been dropped . Is 8t just weakness in the construction or materials used? We are over the deadline for returning this, but may need to purchase another kind . Sigh
customer_reviews.author: stupendous

customer_reviews.title: Much better than older models.
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the pitchers with flappy parts. Also no annoying electronics I never remember how to use. The sticker included works well and stays attached to the lid. The white basin is pretty hard to remove for cleaning but if you work it side to side it will eventually slide out. I have used it with the stardard filters and the 6 month filter and both work great. I usually drink from a 20 ounce blender bottle and filling the basin can usually fill the bottle 1.5 times. As with most Brita filters you are probably going to refill it after every use.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly I save tons of money and the environment!
customer_reviews.text: I have been pissed about buying bottled water for a while. we are on a well and my wife complains about the sulfur smell and the taste. I bought this and the wife is finally happy (at least on this issue) and I am happy because I despise the entire premise of bottled water. We bought bottles we can fill and travel with and this filters great. takes care of the smell and the taste and is like drinking......bottled water but not with the plastic waste, cost and storing, going to the store and....... best money I have spent in years. Filters are cheap and last a long time.! love it!
customer_reviews.author: Zeblives

customer_reviews.title: Standard Brita
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade for my smaller Brita. Finally, after one fill up, I get enough filtered water to fill my 1 L water bottle with a little leftover! I didn't realize this version did not have the filter status indicator. It looks like that version is only 1-2 dollars more, I would definitely get that one instead of this. Now, I will have to rely on taste to determine when to change the filter.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it was the same model as what is carried in stores. It is definitely not. This has to be a super old model, or else it is a knockoff. There is no light to tell you when to change the filter. It is impossible to pull the reservoir out to clean it. It came in packaging that was almost impossible to open. The lid barely stays on. I’m going to see if I can return this... it is such a disappointment. Save your money and just buy one in the store.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Fountain

customer_reviews.title: Was a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: For the first 10 pitchers it worked fine but kept getting progressively slower. By pitcher 12 the amount of time it took was beyond ridiculous getting a pitcher. I put on a new filter even though we only had used it for one week for 12 pitchers. Second filter was the same way. By pitcher 13 it was so slow it was aggravating. I was pretty disappointed. Will use the product til I use up the extra filters I bought then go back to buying gallons of drinking water.
customer_reviews.author: Playtoy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my Brita!!! You won’t regret buying this!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE my Brita!!! I’ll never have to buy water bottles again! So easy to use and the taste is great! You only have to change the filter once every three months which I think is fantastic! If you have to change it before the three months is up or even if you just can’t remember when you changed it last the brita actually shows you the filter needs to be changed with the little filter change light on the top of it which makes things even easier! Can’t recommend this enough!! I save so much money using a brita instead of constantly buying water bottles! You won’t regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Now I can drink water
customer_reviews.text: I never would drink water from the tap because I did not like the taste. Doctor said I must. So I bought this awesome 10 cup Brita water purifier and stuck it in the refrigerator and the wonderful refreshing tasteless water was such a relief to me. Now I drink water all the time because of this Brita water filter. I wish I had done this years ago. It is well worth the money, very well-made and holds a good amount of water which makes it a little heavy so both hands are how I have to handle it but it is so worth every cent. Thank you Brita!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Glass

customer_reviews.title: Excellent flavor over tap or bottled water!
customer_reviews.text: So we ordered this as our daughter has one and we thought it would be a good idea. It holds water, the filter goes in easy as expected. The taste is light years ahead of our tap water and no lie better than any bottled water we have purchased! It is a smooth taste, and now have a hard time drinking any water from another source, it's that good! Would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone looking for better tasting or just cleaning up your tap water. Way better than the filter we use in our refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: TX Hills

customer_reviews.title: LID FALLS OFF
customer_reviews.text: CLOROX GET YOUR ACT TOGETHER! After 1 month, the large plastic lid stopped fitting snugly, and falls off when water is poured, making a VERY ANNOYING SPILL! I had bought another Brita Pitcher which worked for two years, then the same problem happened. So I bought a new one, only to have the SAME PROBLEM, this time after 1 month. I used the Clorox help site, only to have my complaint REJECTED since I used the a different email to respond to a question. AND THEIR HELP LINE IS CONSTANTLY BUSY!
customer_reviews.author: Early Bird

customer_reviews.title: Does the job of getting rid of bad taste.
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for over two months now and it has work flawlessly. I change the filter every 5 to 6 weeks and have not noticed any decrease in the quality of the water. One suggestion is not to overfill it as water will get up in the filler area and may cause bacteria to grow. I refill mine at least twice a day as I drink a lot of water and drinks made with water. For me, so far it has been a good investment for removing the strong taste of chlorine from our city water.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Stiles (hamrad88)

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pitcher
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a long time ago, but just found in my review area. I've owned for at least one year and it is fabulous! I have city water and it removes all the nasty taste. I feel good that I've filtered the water. I actually use the filters longer than they say you can use them for, and it's been fine. It's a really great product. I'm glad I bought it because I still use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: DOROTHY R SANGALLO

customer_reviews.title: ALWAYS FULL!
customer_reviews.text: This Brita Filter has the largest top part ever. You fill that up one time and it fills the entire storage container! Every time I run out all I have to do is fill it up one time and then it is full again. After my last filter that could only take 4 cups at a time I cannot recommend this Brita enough. The container itself is made of thick plastic and can survive being dropped (I would know). The filter needs to be replaced every few months and replacement filters are easy to switch and affordable! Overall 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Just right for us.
customer_reviews.text: We are two people home all day and we make a lot of tea! Now that we have this big jug we don't feel like we're constantly filling it! Two caveats: The lid is a bit hard to grasp for opening and filling. The inset lid handle is smooth and doesn't narrow where you would grab it. If I overfill the jug, and not all the water filters down, the filter floats up out of its position. If I do not notice but just pour some filtered water out, the rest of the water will bypass the floating filter (defeating the purpose).
customer_reviews.author: Amy B.

customer_reviews.title: Works. Not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Works okay. Not perfect. Need following improvement: pours out. 1. Need something to cover the hole where water pours out. 2. Need an easier way to open the area to pour more water in to be filtered. 3. When I lean too far to pour the water as the pitcher is almost empty, the filter will fall out. Have to open up the top lid, which is not easy to do as explained in (2). Decent item given the price. However, I would go with a different model next time.
customer_reviews.author: Live 2 Browse

customer_reviews.title: It makes tap, taste less like tap!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two and we go through water fairly quickly in our home. We drink it, we only give our dogs this water, we use it to cook with and for the coffee pot. It’s super easy to use. Although I’m partially disabled and cannot carry a ton of weight, I tend to have a harder time lifting them at times to pour from but during those times I only put half amount of water which is why we have the two. The water tastes better as our tap tastes kind of chemically.
customer_reviews.author: The Holmen’s

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I did some shopping around for a good price and availability plus if anything offered a replacement if there were any problems. I found it with this item. The ergonomics of the pitcher is ok but would suggest if there were any way to magnetize the filter to stick on the side without interfering with the taste of the water. When you place the filter in it, great but then when you lean it to pour water out, it slams up to the top and sloshes water out but not too bad. Great design though. Great item to buy, plus cuts back on so many water bottles unless needed for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Tyra Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Great pour and size
customer_reviews.text: I like this pitcher a lot. The reservoir holds about a third of the total tank volume, and takes about 5 minutes to purify that third. It's size is much better than other pitchers. I had a Pur pitcher that was way too top heavy and this is more comfortable on the handle when full. The greatest part is the spout. This thing is pretty great at a hassle free pour. Other pitchers just dripped water all over the place (looking at you Pur).
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Raised my Water consumption level.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a town were I get Lake water and the algae bloom in the summer makes the water stink and taste really foul, you just can't stand the taste of the water come late July and August. Ben using this pitcher for months and because its on the table behind me in the office I'm drinking a lot more water. Sodas, Iced Tea, Coffee drinking are way down and water drinking is way up, that has to be much better for me...
customer_reviews.author: R. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: 😍 We can definitely tell the taste of the Brita filtered water is so much better! Tastes like a bottled water. We won't be purchasing bottles water ever again! The lid is difficult to lock into place. I've been hoping it eases with use. It has a little bit. We have to put the pitcher on a flat surface and actually bang with out fist to get it to lock. With time we not had to bang as hard. It's been over a month since we started using it.
customer_reviews.author: Vampy

customer_reviews.title: Good value and durable. Annoying to remove lid for filling.
customer_reviews.text: Good britta pitcher with a good price. Bought this as a replacement as the handle on my last pitcher (different product) broke. This one has a much more durable design and I do not see any parts breaking. Only issue is that to fill the pitcher you need to awkwardly grab and pull off the lid. This part was not designed very well as it is sometimes difficult or annoying to take off. I would have preferred if there was a part you pushed in to lever open the lid like you see in other pitchers to fill them.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: This beats the Zero-water hands down!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Zero-water a while back. Works great in the beginning then after 3-4 weeks starts to taste bitter and citrus like. Apparently I needed new filters... and the cost of the filters was crazy. TRASHED IT! Bought the Britta and LOVE IT. I have clean city water. Just didn't care for the bleach taste which is worse at some times. This removes that bleachy taste and the water tastes great. Happy customer here. Thanks Britta!
customer_reviews.author: Sidjones1

customer_reviews.title: Have to re-fill it constantly for only 2 people at home
customer_reviews.text: Attractive design, and the shape is great to save fridge space. However, this filter is so slow and it seems to hold so little, that we are virtually filling it multiple times per day and there are only the two of us in the house. Thinking about buying a faucet attaching type of filter instead.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma11

customer_reviews.title: I thought about returning it...
customer_reviews.text: I was going to return this Brita water pitcher forna few reasons. First it's so big, bulky and cumbersome. Next reason is that the taste is Chlorine like. And the last reason is because it takes up a lot of real estate especially if we want the water chilled and place tbe pitcher in the refrigerator. I kept it for one reason, I'm tired of returning plastics water bottles for refund. And now with this virus, I'm especially glad I kept it.
customer_reviews.author: "lwb555"

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This pitcher is just what I needed for my elderly father to have an endless supply of fresh water every day. It is large enough to hold a day's worth of water (I make him drink a lot) and all I have to do is just run it under the sink to fill it up more and put it back in the fridge. It's easy to handle with one hand (for people who've had strokes or other disabilities). Very thankful you had this in stock during this time and it's much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: All but eliminates chlorine odor and taste
customer_reviews.text: This product has a smaller than expected filter (compared to PUR I own), but it still delivers good water. Our water has a higher than normal concentration of chlorine because we are at the end of the city water line. But this pitcher removes almost all of the odor and chlorine taste. The PUR is just a little better, but both are outstanding for delivering great tasting drinking water.
customer_reviews.author: Don Enderlein

customer_reviews.title: Good Water Filter Pitcher
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pitcher - very easy to use. Took one star off because it advertised as "Frustration Free" packaging and it definitely wasn't frustration free! A broken nail and a cardboard cut finger and I finally had the picture out of the box. The pitcher was not in a Brita box like you see in the store which is great because it was one less thing to throw away but it you were buying it for a gift it might not be so great.
customer_reviews.author: Nashville066

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wasnt expecting much when I bought this, just wanted something more convenient for water refills at the dinner table. But after using it for a few weeks, I drank a cup of water from the water dispenser on the outside of my fridge and there really is a big difference in taste. I was worried about a few reviews saying you cant take the white part with the filter in it out of the pitcher to wash and clean, but mine does come out...just took a little force. So far I'm loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Amran Hizam

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!  This filter doesn't work to remove the bad taste and chlorine or other chemicals!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't even give this one star but there isn't a choice for less. I tried to return it because the water tasted awful but they wouldn't allow it even though it says satisfaction guaranteed. It also is to remove chemicals but in fine print it says it doesn't remove all the fluoride. If I wanted to keep the chemical I wouldn't have purchased a filter to remove the chemicals and other unhealthy things from my drinking water. I have a filtration system in my home which is great but I wanted this for use at my summer place and I now have to buy a different brand and eat the cost of this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but doesn't remove all bad flavors
customer_reviews.text: We live in a place where the water tastes like bleach at times, because there are so minerals. This pitcher works pretty well for our purposes, and helps with the taste of the water. We don't want to rely on bottled water, so this was a better alternative. If your water is already drinkable flavor wise, this would be a great extra step to remove impurities. If you are like us and your water is plain terrible this works in a pinch, but overall I would want to invest in a filter system.
customer_reviews.author: Alex List

customer_reviews.title: It keeps water clean
customer_reviews.text: I do like the ergonomic shape, that allows it to fit neatly on the top shelf of the refrigerator. I enjoy the flavor of the water and the fact that I do not have to be reliant on my water from the refrigerator or bottled water. I feel that with Brita or another filter because it also fits other brands, it makes a huge difference in my life if there is a hurricane or natural disaster. Thank you for the great shape and product.
customer_reviews.author: CREVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: Filter did not fit properly or filter correctly!
customer_reviews.text: Filter did not fit properly, was loose enough to float when water added to top. Filter itself didn’t work right, would not drain out of all the holes in bottom, plus being so loose, a stream of water ran down the side of the filter. Unfortunately, I had to have surgery and was gone several weeks, just got home yesterday and it says “window for return ended July 10th”! Thanks a lot AMAZON! On a fixed budget I can’t afford another one!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without it
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: I just purchased this item again and I received the box with nothing inside! No pitcher, no water filter, nothing! It was just empty. Very disappointing and upsetting. We keep this in our fridge and it has just made our lives so much better. My spouse no longer wants or needs to buy all the plastic water bottles anymore. The water comes out basically flavorless which is perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: Love itt
customer_reviews.text: This is the best water pitcher/filter i've found to this day. I love how the top does not fall off when pouring water, the filtration is fast, and yes, the reservoir DOES come out of the water pitcher. It takes a bit of working it to come out but that's a good thing! That means it wont obnoxiously fall out of the pitcher when pouring water like other pitchers do. I have not found 1 flaw with this pitcher and have been using it for months. I could see this becoming a long term solution to cleaner, safer drinking water.
customer_reviews.author: brooke husing

customer_reviews.title: Pours extremely slow!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This particular brita pours extremely slow. It even filters slow! It takes more than 5 minutes for it to literally fill up the pitcher half way. It’s so annoying. And the filter fell out into my drink while I was pouring my water. 🤦🏾‍♀️ I only purchased because my other brita cracked after a short fall from the fridge. I think 💭 it’s time to look for a new water filter
customer_reviews.author: ✨Yazzi 💫

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: My tap water has been one of the best for many, many years but in the last year some strange aromas and tastes appeared so I decided to give Brita a try. I have been using it for 4 months and have no complains - changed the filter couple of weeks ago so overall, very good value compared to Sparkletts, Desani or any other filtered bottled water. Compared to spring water, is better than Arrowhead who can be harsh on the vocal chords or the too acidic Crystal Geyser.
customer_reviews.author: cameliaTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after moving to Florida from New England. I’m used to great tasting water and Florida water tasted terrible to me. We moved to a temporary apartment when I bought it and later moved to a house which had a refrigerator with a water dispenser and a filter so I didn’t expect to use the Brita anymore, but the water from the pitcher still tastes much better than the water from the refrigerator filter.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Water filter that actually improves water
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 4 months now and right when I got it, I could already taste the difference from my tap water and my older filter, this water tastes cleaner, looks clear and clean, and can hold a lot of water, which is the biggest thing that I wanted, this can hold 4 or 5 large cups of water, so you don’t have to refill it multiple times a day. The filters you can buy are also cheap, and cleanable so it doesn’t cost too much money to get new filters.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Richard

customer_reviews.title: Purifies the Water
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Brita pitcher that I’ve had and I’m very happy with it so far. It cleans and purifies the water very well and removes the bad taste of normal tap water. I got this specific pitcher because these filters are easier to find and cheaper to replace than the Brita stream filters which now seem like they are out of stock. This pitcher holds about 10 cups of water.
customer_reviews.author: Crisko

customer_reviews.title: no spout cover, requires two hands for pouring for me
customer_reviews.text: Didn't notice before ordering that the top has no cover for the spout. Since I leave my pitcher on the counter, I generally lay the cover on top of the pitcher backwards so that basin and spout are both covered. I thought I would like the larger size but when full the pitcher is clumsy to handle with only one hand. The water weight is too far forward...perhaps could be solved by a taller and thinner design but then folks make have trouble fitting it on a refrigerator shelf. This design was a dud for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS A GREAT BRITA
customer_reviews.text: Like a lot of people, I own a couple "old" Brita's what I love about his one is that it pours and fills so easily. It was a surprise until I received it. Now I would love to replace all my old Brita's with this new model but let's not get too crazy. Buy it; you will be pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Same good filtered water pitcher as before
customer_reviews.text: Bought "same" pitcher about 10 years ago for my mother, and it served well until the pitcher cracked. The new pitcher has the same profile, but a flat lid instead of domed lid will let it fit into a slightly tighter space in the refrigerator. Handle in the lid makes it slightly easier to refill. New filter cartridge looks a bit different, but fits precisely the same.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Filter very slow
customer_reviews.text: Pitcher itself is okay I guess but the filter it came with is very very very slow. Takes multiple trips to the sink and waiting in between to fill the whole jug. Very frustrating. Tried a brand new brita filter from the a different package and it was the same issue. The new model of filters are all terrible. Tried multiple new filters, all slow. Im using standard, not long last, and still pretty slow. These arent duds, they just arent made the way they used to.
customer_reviews.author: HA

customer_reviews.title: The top doesn't stay on
customer_reviews.text: The top doesn't click into place or stay on easily, which is annoying. I called the manufacturer and they were very nice and sent me 2 replacement water pitchers of the same model. Unfortunately, the top of the replacement water pitcher also falls off all the time so I think this is a manufacturing defect for this model. I've had other Brita water pitchers and never had this problem before. It must be just this model.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Lee

customer_reviews.title: Not the easiest to hold and carry
customer_reviews.text: The real down side to this pitcher is that it’s difficult to hold up once you fill the pitcher. You can’t hold it on the middle of the handle because the weight of the pitcher. It tips the pitcher forward and you can’t hold it straight up. It is very awkward. I end up having to hold it by the top of the handle. I’ve had other Brita pitchers before and never had an issue like this before.
customer_reviews.author: Truman

customer_reviews.title: Two bugs pending for fixation
customer_reviews.text: The product served its basic functions while has two big bugs pending for improvement: 1) if observe the water stream carefully passing down through the filter, there is 1/5 of water did not pass down through the filter while from the gaps between the filter and the filter holder. 2) the filter attachment is not firm enough so that it falls off the container when tilting the container closing to the horizontal angle
customer_reviews.author: Hao Ding

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing and everyone NEEDS one at home
customer_reviews.text: I love how it’s so easy to use, the instructions are clear. Once you run the filter a couple times (maybe 3 or 4) the water is ready to drink. Water tastes smooth and crisp. Definitely will keep buying more filters! Love that you can buy the 2 month or the 6 month, also very easy to distinguish from both, white is the 2 month and blue is the 6 month. I will recommend to buy it! (Especially since this review came when I’m in quarantine, not having to worry about buying water bottles)
customer_reviews.author: Steysi Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product
customer_reviews.text: Works well to filter water. Easy set up. Seems fairly sturdy but I’ve only had it for a few weeks. It doesn’t hold a whole lot of water. I usually need to refill it after a few cups so it stays full and cold when I want it. But I’m the only one in my house that uses it so I would recommend going with a larger size if more than 2 people are using it and your worried they may not refill it after every one or two uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good water
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to follow the included instructions on how to set up your water filter and you should be fine. Ours has been great, I bought it because there was no spring water left at the store due to coronavirus panic, and it has turned out to not only save us early morning fights to get a case of water, but it has saved us so much money. (Not to mention it has also prevented exposing ourselves to germs on days we would have needed more water.)
customer_reviews.author: Gina S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size. Easy set up. Don’t buy bottled water anymore .
customer_reviews.text: I can really tell the difference in a city tab water. Easy set up and go. Really takes no time at all for the reservoir to produce crystal clear water. Sits in the back corner of my refrigerator. It is a little heavy when it’s completely full. For a single person it’s more than enough water to keep in your fridge and fill a water bottle. I drink about a liter of water a day now.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja

customer_reviews.title: Njaaa
customer_reviews.text: The thing about this pitcher is, that it is extremely difficult to pull the white insert out of the pitcher, for example if you want to wash the pitcher. It is absolutely crucial that you pull out the filter every time you filtered your water, because it will get moldy and so you can trash it to the bin and buy a new one without bacteria and fungi ;-) Not the most convenient device, but the price was also low, so just keep the pitcher clean and take care of the filters, then youre fine :-)
customer_reviews.author: Kasia

customer_reviews.title: It's ok - but get the "Grand" not this one
customer_reviews.text: For just a few dollars more, the Grand is more convenient. This one is sort of a pain because you have to constantly remove the lid to fill. It does not pivot. The Grand pitcher has a pivoting lid that you do not have to remove to fill the pitcher. It's ok, I use a lot of water. It'll do. The Grand also has a "filter replacement reminder" feature which this one does not. The filtered water does not seem to get cloudy and slimy, so it's working as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Bird Person

customer_reviews.title: Clean Water
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down & bought this for my drinking water. I drink a lot of water & my son kept talking about a water system. Too expensive for my budget, so I did the next best thing. Buying bottled water and recycling plastic is not in my wheel house. I’ve looked at Brita for years & made the decision to switch. I’m very satisfied with the pitcher & would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: LMH1917

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T EVEN REMOVE CHLORINE TASTE
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money. This water filter does not work. The water tastes just the same as tap water. Even the chlorine taste is still there after filtering. Should've done more research before buying - there are a lot better water filters for the same price in the market! Poor design - very annoying to take the whole lid off once a refill is needed. The water runs through the filter so fast that it's no wonder it doesn't work. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pauls Pujats

customer_reviews.title: Is the pitcher  BPA free or just the filter?
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year it cracked. The old one lasted 7 years so the new one is more delicate. When I tried to order again I noticed in the description that BPA free refers to the filter not the picher itself. So Is the water sitting the plastic dish which is not BPA free? I ended up ordering different brand that IS free of BPA.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Like the taste of water
customer_reviews.text: But hate how slow it takes for the water to go through the filter. I usually have to fill the top and put it in the fridge and come back later and fill it again. It's hard to measure to out that last little bit to because it fills so slowly you don't know if you’ve put too much which I usually have.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: filter quality requirs improvement
customer_reviews.text: easy to use. but the filter seems a little broken. Carbon fiber leaks for a long time. even after 10 times recycle. Asked Amazon, but it leaded me to Brita instead of solving the problem itself. Even if I want to replace it, I still need to contact with Brita not Amazon. bored to be a ball kicked here and there. 3 star is for you both.
customer_reviews.author: empty life

customer_reviews.title: Going strong almost 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Had this for almost 3 years, faced no issues. No cracks or anything of the sort. Durable. I change the filter every 2 months as directed. I used to think my tap water was fine but the filtered water tastes much better. The water tastes much cleaner (less metallic) than tap water.
customer_reviews.author: KaptainKarma

customer_reviews.title: Don't have water through the freezer door but this works very well as a substitute
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a refrigerator/freezer with water through the door so I bought this Brita pitcher so I would have cold water "on demand". It works well and doesn't take up a lot of space in the refrigerator. It is good sized and is slightly heavy when filled so you have to be careful taking it in and out of the fridge. My wife commented at first on the weight but has had no trouble using the pitcher. We're happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joel C

customer_reviews.title: FOR HEALTHY CLEAN WATER
customer_reviews.text: BRITA Pitcher & Filer purify water leaving it to taste good and fresh. The pitcher is heavy (smaller people) recommend pouring with two hands. The filters last about 3-4 months to be safe, it will not alert you to change filter must be done manually. Heavy but larger, will not have to refill constantly (not including large families). Better than the small pitchers !
customer_reviews.author: Stop

customer_reviews.title: Removes the chlorine, chloramine taste and smell.
customer_reviews.text: It removes the chlorine, chloramine taste and smell from my town tap water. The two things I dislike is that it does not seal, the spout is alway open and there isn’t a seal between the top and bottom sections or the filter and top sections. The bottom line, It’s definitely worth the price and the filter last two months and are not over priced.
customer_reviews.author: RLO

customer_reviews.title: THERE'S NO INDICATOR and NOT RETURNABLE
customer_reviews.text: I mistakenly think the sticker from the photo as the indicator that indicates whether the filter should be changed. It turns out it's just a sticker. Now how am I supposed to know when to change the filter. Not to mention that it's not returnable. I should go with the $19.99 one, which has an indicator. Also, the filter falls out of its position every time when I pour the water.
customer_reviews.author: xueting li

customer_reviews.title: Excellent taste
customer_reviews.text: The chlorine in the water where I live is awful. The water gets a funky smell and taste so we had been using bottled water which was expensive. The water with this picture is great. It’s just my daughter and myself, so size wise it works, but if there were more I’d either need a larger picture or a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Large Capacity
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Brita pitcher for years. When my last one got a chipped top after many years of use, I ordered this model. At first, I was concerned because it was a big larger and wider than my last model. However, it still fits well in my fridge and the larger capacity mean longer time between refills.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Should have left the design alone
customer_reviews.text: The filter slips out when you are nearing the end of the water in the reservoir. No easy flip up cap like the old design you need to remove the whole thing no more one handed filling. It's fat now and doesn't slip in between the milk and other tall items in the fridge. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Dubois

customer_reviews.title: Makes great tasting water
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe the difference in the taste of my water.(or lack there-of) Very pleased with this purchase. Updated review after one month. I've lowered the rating drastically because of two issues. 1. is the unfiltered water leaks from the lid so you have to wait for all water to be filtered before pouring and 2. having well water I find I'm replacing the filter almost every week because the filter plugs up won't let water through.
customer_reviews.author: cobweb

customer_reviews.title: Nice Brita Water Filter Pitcher
customer_reviews.text: We love this Everyday Brita pitcher. We notice the difference in the taste of the tap vs the Brita. It’s a huge pitcher that can be a little heavy, but, nice looking sitting on the table or counter for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. If I were single I’d opt for the 5 cup, but, this 10 cup is perfect for a family. We fill it up once a day. It came with a standard filter that is recommended to change every 2 months. We priced it on Amazon where we can get 6 filters for $24, which is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Beaustarfish

customer_reviews.title: Sticker glue is a pain to remove.
customer_reviews.text: Good filter, except for some inexplicable reason they chose to slap a transparent sticker with aggressive adhesive on the bottom. The sticker has ripples and bubbles that will develop algae growth when exposed to moisture, if not removed. Any decent product manufacturer these days knows (or should know) to use easy-peel stickers that can be easily removed without leaving glue on the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Elena.st

customer_reviews.title: Use this Pitcher Better Tasting Water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pitcher to try out the whole water filter s before system before would change any plumbing in my home. I fill up the pitcher once a day and use the water for cooking and drinking. I have noticed that I drink more water throughout the day because the water filter delivers a better tasting cup of water. I would recommend this pitcher for a single person or a small family. I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Its good for water and the environment
customer_reviews.text: I like it filters my water. I don't like if I fill the top and it has too much water it pours with the filtered water. I just have to be careful. I do like nnot using so many plastic bottles. I live in AZ and we go through tons and this is one way we can help the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Need a Britta filter? This one is as standard as it comes. (In a good way!)
customer_reviews.text: Your standard Britta water filter. I keep mine beside the sink ready to fill but it's small enough to easily go in the fridge. I definitely notice the taste in water and I use this filter to give my reptiles clean water too! The only downside to this pitcher is that you have to take the whole lid off to fill. I've had another Britta filter where you could just pour water over a vent at the top and it opens to allow water in. Other than that this is a pretty good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better Design
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used the Brita Water Pitchers for several years now because they always did a good job of filtering our water. What I didn’t like was the design of the pitcher. The old design always leaked when you tried to pour a glass of water and made a mess. This new design works perfectly! No dripping and no mess. I was actually thinking of buying another filtering pitcher. Glad I decided to give Brita another try!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy E

customer_reviews.title: Handle snapped off
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine until handle cam off on top where it meets the base. The weight of the water was apparently not considered in the design as it easily snapped off when full.
customer_reviews.author: Mattias P. Blom

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I have VERY hard water, to the point that I was having to descale my coffee maker weekly, or even every couple of days. Since I’ve been running my water through this pitcher before filling my coffee maker, I have not had to descale my coffee maker yet, and it’s been over a month. Great for drinking water too!
customer_reviews.author: Valkyrie

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use at all.. disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Even it looks nice but it's too difficult to use. In order each time you add water in it you need take out the cover, add water and then close it up. Other models are easier to use. You don't need to use two hands for the simple filling up operation. Not wise ! Mine even came with a defect.
customer_reviews.author: V_T_M

customer_reviews.title: Still using pitcher 5 years
customer_reviews.text: This pitcher hold daily water in my refrig- I change the filter with a discounted brand. Filter replaced every 4 weeks- Sturdy- Clear- Safe- Durable- Clean & rinse entire pitcher / outside is important. Water is pure- I do boil to be safe- ( coffee, tea, etc )
customer_reviews.author: Lori Swaen

customer_reviews.title: Nasty Water
customer_reviews.text: I did a TDS (Total Dissolved Solids) test moments after Amazon dropped this pitcher off and the TDS meter shows only a slight variation from straight tap water! Returning immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: it is made of cheep plastic
customer_reviews.text: I love Brita, I got this as a replacement. Well my old one got knocked of the counter by the cat and it busted, same thing, I knocked it off the counter and busted into pieces just cratered in. Not sure I will buy another one. Not happy that it broke so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great Clear Clean Fresh Tasting Water
customer_reviews.text: Love this pitcher. Is so much better and easier to clean than the older Brita model I had for many years. Hope this one will last as long as the other. So good to have fresh water - this takes the ammonia out of my water which is so strong you can smell it - the Brita pitchers take it all out and I can drink my city water again. This came quickly and I will always stick with Brita pitchers as they work terrific. The replacement filters are not that expensive and so worth it to have great tasting clear clean water. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Great taste and great price
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas gift and it’s great. So happy to not be spending money on plastic water bottles. The water tastes good and it filters pretty quickly. Fits perfectly in the fridge. Buying the filter replacements every few months isn’t too expensive either. Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle2133

product_meta.title: Brita Everyday Pitcher with 1 Filter, w 1 std, White
product_meta.description: Size:Pitcher w 1 std filterDrink healthier, great tasting tap water with this BPA free Brita 10 cup water pitcher. With the Advanced filter technology, Brita cuts the taste and odor of chlorine to deliver great tasting water, and is certified to reduce copper, cadmium and mercury impurities, which can adversely affect your health over time. The Brita water pitchers flip top lid makes refilling a breeze and just a glance at the sticker filter indicator lets you know when it is time to change the Brita replacement filter. This large water pitcher comes with 1 water filter, which should be changed every 40 gallons or about 2 months for best results. Start drinking healthier, great tasting water with Brita today.
feature_bullets: LARGE WATER PITCHER: This large, clear plastic pitcher is easy to pour and refill. Great for families. Height 10.47; Width 5.59; Length/Depth 10.94; Weight 2.29 pounds
CLEANER AND GREAT TASTING: The BPA free Brita filter reduces chlorine taste and odor, copper, mercury, and cadmium impurities found in tap water. Substances reduced may not be in all users’ water.
FILTER INDICATOR: For optimum performance, a helpful status indicator notifies you when your water filter needs to be replaced.
REDUCE WASTE: One Brita water filter can replace 300 standard 16.9 ounce water bottles.
REPLACEMENTS: Change Brita filters every 40 gallons, about 2 months for the average household for optimal performance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars10,399 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
